title: Capacitor - potential change caused by dielectric

content.question: A parallel plate capacitor is charged by a battery. The battery is removed and replaced by an ideal voltmeter which indicates that the potential across the capacitor is <math alttext="6.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>6.0</mtext></mstyle></math> volts. An insulating slab is then completely inserted into the space between the plates of the capacitor, after which the voltmeter reads <math alttext="2.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn></math> volts. What is the dielectric constant of the insulating slab?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
